getCookie(c_name){	var i,x,y,ARRcookies=document.cookie.split(";");	for (i=0;i<ARRcookies.length;i++){	x=ARRcookies[i].substr(0,ARRcookies[i].indexOf("="));	y=ARRcookies[i].substr(ARRcookies[i].indexOf("=")+1);	x=x.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g,"");	if (x==c_name){	return ng-href="{{mos.profileUrl}}" ng-bind="mos.fullName" class="cb-link-undrln"></a></div></div></script><div class="cb-col cb-col-100 cb-comm-static"><div id="text_link_container" class="cb-ad-unit cb-col cb-col-100 bg-white ng-isolate-scope" ad-direct-call="true" ad-loaded="true" ad-has-default="true" ad-repetitive-index="native_commentary_text_link" ad-content="<a rel=&quot;nofollow noreferrer&quot; href=&quot;[[clk]]&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; class=&quot;ad-plugin cb-comm-static-anchr&quot;>[[title]]<img src=&quot;[[logo]]&quot; height =&quot;14px&quot; style=&quot;margin-left:10px;&quot;/></a>" style="min-height:31px;"><span class="ad-comm-text-links"></span></div></div><style>.cb-min-vid{background: #000; color:#fff; padding:5px; height:54px; overflow: hidden; margin:0px -10px 0 0;}</style> <div ng-show="!isCommentaryRendered" class="ng-hide"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> LSG's bowling lineup before their first game with Avesh, Akash Deep and Mayank Yadav out looked so weak on paper that they were considered cannon-fodder for the batters. But four games in, they have beaten SRH and MI and lost a close game to DC. And Avesh and Akash Deep are back as well. The real pluses though for them have been Shardul and Rathi who both have been superb so far. That brings an end to proceedings for tonight. Tomorow is Saturday - which only means one thing - double-header time. We will be there for all of that jazz. Till then sleep tight and snore well. See you tomorrow. Bye.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>Digvesh Rathi | Player of the Match (translated from Hindi by Pant):</b> I'm really enjoying it. I like to get batters out. I watched Sunil Narine bowl and from that time I took to bowling. I want to make my mindset more attacking, want to be like Narine, on how he stays calm even during pressure situations. (on the Dhir wicket) Before that over, I spoke to you (Pant), we wanted a mid-wicket. But we did not have one, he looked to play through there and that move really worked for us.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>Rishabh Pant:</b> One thing is sure is that the wicket is playing really well and we need to figure out what's working for us and what is not. Very simple. Before we wanted a different kind of wicket, but whatever was offered to us we will take it and play. When a player like Mitch Marsh gives us a start like that, it gives time to the middle-order. That's the idea, we want to play according to the situation, the kind of start we got it put us in a good state. Mentally it was tough for all of us, they were not losing too many wickets, kudos to them, but we held our nerve and finished it off. (on Shardul) He is amazing for us, now I can say that he has been an amazing pick. We need to back him. (on Rathi) He is one of our leading bowlers, the way he his holding his nerve and good to see a youngster perform like that.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> Stats by <i>Shashikant Singh</i></p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>Retired out in the IPL</b> <br>R Ashwin vs LSG, Wankhede, 2022 <br>Atharva Taide vs DC, Dharamshala, 2023 <br>Sai Sudharsan vs MI, Ahmedabad, 2023 <br>Tilak Varma vs LSG, Lucknow, 2025*</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> - LSG have won 6 out of 7 matches against the Mumbai Indians, including three wins at Ekana. MI’s only win came in the 2023 Eliminator at Chepauk.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> - 394 runs today is the second-highest match aggregate in 46 T20 matches at this venue, after 395 runs between LSG and RR last year.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>Shardul Thakur:</b> There is always pressure when you are bowling the penultimate or the last over, Avesh did a great job as well. But at the end of the day you're paid to do that job. It was a tricky surface, sometimes you thought the slower ones would work but even a few slower ones were hit for boundaries, in the end it was the yorkers that worked. We do see what happened in the first half, but we have seen in the IPL that the pitch changes in the second half and becomes better, it is about adjusting to the conditions. He (Rathi) is a phenomenal bowler and a character as well, we need such guys in the team - who comes in and delivers for the team and he has been a bit of a surprise in the IPL. I feel the bounce is even on the red soil and the ball comes on nicely but you need more skills as a batter on black soil when there's no dew.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>Hardik Pandya:</b> It has been disappointing when you lose. If we have to be honest, on the field, we gave away 10-15 runs on that wicket. I have always enjoyed my bowling (on his fifer). I don't think I have many options. I try to read the wicket and try some smart options. I dont try to go for wickets. I try to bowl dot balls and let the batters take risks. I think as a batting unit, we fell short. We win as a team. We lose as a team. Don't want to point someone out. The ownership has to be taken by the whole batting unit. I take full ownership. It was obvious (on Tilak being retired out). We needed some hits. In cricket, some of those days come. When you try but it doesn't come off. Just play good cricket. I like to keep it simple. Take better calls. Be smart in bowling. Take chances in batting. Play simple cricket with some aggression. As it is a long tournament, couple of wins and we might get into the rhythm.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> Justin Langer - LSG's head coach hugs the curator and pats him, the curator is thrilled as he flashes a wide smile. Then Langer goes to a few groundstaff to offer his hand.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> Pant is more relieved than anything. He hugs his team-mates and manages to smile. Sanjiv Goenka comes down to shake hands with him and Pant manages to offer a big smile to Goenka.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>23:24 Local Time, 17:54 GMT, 23:24 IST:</b> Hardik Pandya manages a tame smile as he shakes hands with his opponents. LSG hang on to win this one. The move to promote Dhir to 3 worked tonight and along with SKY the duo threatened to take the game away from their opponents. This after the early fall of the openers who fell in a similar fashion, finding deep backward square-leg with swings to leg. First ball after the timeout, Rathi struck to get Dhir and LSG came back. Tilak came in and was a major reason for MI struggling during that phase. He failed to rotate the strike and put pressure on SKY. SKY's wicket was the biggest turning point for until then he was in great form. Even the move to retire Tilak out did not help as it was too late by then. Avesh Khan held his nerve to defend 21 off the last over. So yet again MI fail to win on the road. A word on Rathi who was outstanding and his overs ultimately proved to be the difference. Even SKY did not try to take risks against him. Hang around for the presentations...</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-8 text-bold"> <div title="" class="cb-mat-mnu-wrp cb-ovr-num">19.6</div> </div> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-90"> Avesh Khan to Santner, no run, <b>LSG win.</b> Full outside off, Santner shuffles across and drags the hoick to mid-wicket, they don't even bother to run</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>13 off 1.</b> Sanjiv Goenka is all smiles as he claps watching on. Akash Ambani meanwhile is in an animated chat with someone. He is not happy. Still Avesh Khan wants the field to be right.</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-8 text-bold"> <div title="" class="cb-mat-mnu-wrp cb-ovr-num">19.5</div> </div> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-90"> Avesh Khan to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, low full-toss just outside off, Hardik Pandya toe-ends the loft to long-off and just one</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-8 text-bold"> <div title="" class="cb-mat-mnu-wrp cb-ovr-num">19.4</div> </div> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-90"> Avesh Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, LSG know that they have done it. Full and in the slot outside off, Hardik Pandya with a big slog to leg, loses his shape and the thick inside-edge hits his left leg and rolls away to the off-side. There is no run there and that should be it for MI</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-8 text-bold"> <div title="" class="cb-mat-mnu-wrp cb-ovr-num">19.3</div> </div> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-90"> Avesh Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, Hardik Pandya has decided to turn the run down. A low full-toss on leg-stump, swung straight to the fielder at deep backward square-leg and there was no two there</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> <b>14 off 4</b></p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <div class="cb-col cb-col-8 text-bold"> <div title="" class="cb-mat-mnu-wrp cb-ovr-num">19.2</div> </div> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-90"> Avesh Khan to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, very full on middle and leg, whipped wide of deep mid-wicket and they come back for two</p> </div> <div class="cb-col cb-col-100"> <p class="cb-com-ln cb-col cb-col-100"> By the way <b>LSG are having an extra fielder inside the ring for poor over-rate</b>. Avesh Khan now with field changes. Four in the off-side. A long-off back. Long-on, deep mid-wicket and deep square-leg back.</p> </div> </div> <div id="hys_modal" class="cb-modal-open disp-none"> <div class="cb-modal-background" onclick="modal_toggle('hys_modal', their first game with Avesh, Akash Deep and Mayank Yadav out looked so weak on paper that they were considered cannon-fodder for the batters. But four games in, they have beaten SRH and MI and lost a close game to DC. And Avesh and Akash Deep are back as well. I like to get batters out. I watched Sunil Narine bowl and from that time I took to bowling. I want to make my mindset more attacking, want to be like Narine, on how he stays calm even during pressure situations. (on the Dhir wicket) Before that over, I spoke to you (Pant), we wanted a mid-wicket. But we did not have one, he looked to play through there and that move really worked for us.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><div style="clear: both;"></div><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].videoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].videoId --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo && comm[ts].videoType == 'Wicket' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:news' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:comments' --></div></div><!-- end ngRepeat: ts in match.timestamps --><!-- ngInclude: 'commentary' --><div ng-repeat="ts in match.timestamps" ng-init="comm = match.commentary" ng-include="'commentary'" class="ng-scope"><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('hun-overbreak') && isFormatHundred --> <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743791135550" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.length > 0 &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.indexOf($root.$GEO.country) == -1" ng-if="comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments'"><b>Rishabh Pant:</b> One thing is sure is that the wicket is playing really well and we need to figure out what's working for us and what is not. Very simple. Before we wanted a  different kind of wicket, but whatever was offered to us we will take it and play. When a player like Mitch Marsh gives us a start like that, it gives time to the middle-order. That's the idea, we want to play according to the situation, the kind of start we got it put us in a good state. Mentally it was tough for all of us, they were not losing too many wickets, kudos to them, but we held our nerve and finished it off. (on Shardul) He is amazing for us, now I can say that he has been an amazing pick. We need to back him. (on Rathi) He is one of our leading bowlers, the way he his holding his nerve and good to see a youngster perform like that.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.length > 0 &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.indexOf($root.$GEO.country) == -1" ng-if="comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments'"><b>Shardul Thakur:</b> There is always pressure when you are bowling the penultimate or the last over, Avesh did a great job as well. But at the end of the day you're paid to do that job. It was a tricky surface, sometimes you thought the slower ones would work but even a few slower ones were hit for boundaries, in the end it was the yorkers that worked. We do see what happened in the first half, but we have seen in the IPL that the pitch changes in the second half and becomes better, it is about adjusting to the conditions. He (Rathi) is a phenomenal bowler and a character as well, we need such guys in the team - who comes in and delivers for the team and he has been a bit of a surprise in the IPL. I feel the bounce is even on the red soil and the ball comes on nicely but you need more skills as a batter on black soil when there's no dew.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><div style="clear: both;"></div><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].videoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].videoId --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo && comm[ts].videoType == 'Wicket' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:news' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:comments' --></div></div><!-- end ngRepeat: ts in match.timestamps --><!-- ngInclude: 'commentary' --><div ng-repeat="ts in match.timestamps" ng-init="comm = match.commentary" ng-include="'commentary'" class="ng-scope"><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('hun-overbreak') && isFormatHundred --> <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743790137079" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.length > 0 &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.indexOf($root.$GEO.country) == -1" ng-if="comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments'"><b>Hardik Pandya:</b> It has been disappointing when you lose. If we have to be honest, on the field, we gave away 10-15 runs on that wicket. I have always enjoyed my bowling (on his fifer). I don't think I have many options. I try to read the wicket and try some smart options. I dont try to go for wickets. I try to bowl dot balls and let the batters take risks. I think as a batting unit, we fell short. We win as a team. We lose as a team. Don't want to point someone out. The ownership has to be taken by the whole batting unit. I take full ownership. It was obvious (on Tilak being retired out). We needed some hits. In cricket, some of those days come. When you try but it doesn't come off. Just play good cricket. I like to keep it simple. Take better calls. Be smart in bowling. Take chances in batting. Play simple cricket with some aggression. As it is a long tournament, couple of wins and we might get into the rhythm.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><div style="clear: both;"></div><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].videoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].videoId --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo && comm[ts].videoType == 'Wicket' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:news' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:comments' --></div></div><!-- end ngRepeat: ts in match.timestamps --><!-- ngInclude: 'commentary' --><div ng-repeat="ts in match.timestamps" ng-init="comm = match.commentary" ng-include="'commentary'" class="ng-scope"><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('hun-overbreak') && isFormatHundred --> <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743789858346" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; being sent into bat. The pitch is not a belter and it needed some smart batting from them to get past the 200-mark. Marsh survived a non-review in the very first over and he made the Mumbai Indians pay for that, he was instrumental in getting the Super Giants off to a flier as he smashed 60 runs in the powerplay and the opening stand added 76. There was a slight stutter as they lost three wickets (Marsh, Pooran and Pant) in quick time but the partnership between Markram and Badoni got the innings back on track, the pair added 50+ in express time and Miller gave the finishing touches. Hardik used the conditions pretty well and recorded his best IPL figures but his batters are up against it. If there's no dew then this won't be an easy chase. Let's see what transpires in the second half. Their bowling has been hampered and hence the results haven't gone their way. Remedy is for them to have their skipper firing on all cylinders. MI had Rickelton firing for them. Varma has been good. SKY seems to be finding his mojo. Pandya as usual is priceless. It would be vital for them to have Rohit firing for them at the top.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><div style="clear: both;"></div><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].videoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].videoId --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo && comm[ts].videoType == 'Wicket' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:news' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:comments' --></div></div><!-- end ngRepeat: ts in match.full_commentary.timestamps --><!-- ngInclude: 'commentary' --><div ng-repeat="ts in match.full_commentary.timestamps" ng-init="comm = match.full_commentary.commentary" ng-include="'commentary'" class="ng-scope"><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('hun-overbreak') && isFormatHundred --> <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743772872190" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; Daren Ganga:</b> We are moving from pitch number 4 which is red soil to pitch number 6, this is black soil. There will be a change on the square boundaries - 73 and 66 meters square, 78 meters down the ground. It is dark, it is black, it has got a covering a grass but you're seeing that bare patches all around. The seam movement was quite low in the previous game, spin was only 1.4 degrees and the average bounce was very good for batting, you could hit through the line, but with this black soil there will be lowering of bounce. Spinners might get a little more turn and it will be a little bit slower. The average first innings score is 181 and that's your benchmark for batting first.</p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><div style="clear: both;"></div><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].videoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].videoId --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && !comm[ts].matchVideo --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].cbvideoId && comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:video' && !comm[ts].show_video && comm[ts].matchVideo && comm[ts].videoType == 'Wicket' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:news' --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt == 'Plugin:comments' --></div></div><!-- end ngRepeat: ts in match.full_commentary.timestamps --><!-- ngInclude: 'commentary' --><div ng-repeat="ts in match.full_commentary.timestamps" ng-init="comm = match.full_commentary.commentary" ng-include="'commentary'" class="ng-scope"><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('hun-overbreak') && isFormatHundred --> <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743772347007" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; <!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt.includes('over-break') && !isFormatHundred --><div id="comm_1743689786715" class="cb-col cb-col-100 ng-scope"><!-- ngRepeat: event in comm[ts].event_plugin --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].o_no > 0 || comm[ts].ball_no > 0 || ( comm[ts].videoId != null && comm[ts].evt.indexOf('Plugin') < 0) --><!-- ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments' --><p ng-bind-html="comm[ts].comm" class="cb-com-ln ng-binding ng-scope cb-col cb-col-100" ng-class="get_comm_class(comm[ts]) " ng-hide="comm[ts].geo != null &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.length > 0 &amp;&amp; comm[ts].geo.indexOf($root.$GEO.country) == -1" ng-if="comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' &amp;&amp; comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:comments'"><b>Preview by Pratyush Sinha</b>      <br>        <br><b>A new squad under a new captain. 40,000 odd in attendance.</b> First home game of the season. The way Lucknow Super Giants tanked against Punjab Kings would have hurt. And it was evident in their newly-appointed mentor <b>Zaheer Khan's</b> short butexplosive press conference, where he expressed disappointment at not only the loss but also the playing surface, going as far as saying that it felt like it was prepared by a <b>"Punjab curator".</b> Oops.        <br>        <br>That Lucknow, with its slow surfaces and large boundaries, isn't a routine venue for <b>200+ scores has been established over the years.</b> In fact, there's only ever been one total above 200 since it started hosting IPL matches. The disappointment, it's understood, stemmed less from the pitch itself and more from how it was interpreted in the leadup to the match. Perhaps expecting the red-soil pitch to behave a bit differently, LSG played only two pacers and four spin options as opposed to PBKS, who bowled as many as 13 overs of pace and to good effect.        <br>        <br>Learning things the hard way, LSG are expected to revisit their playing combination for this match against Mumbai Indians, especially on a <b>black-soil pitch</b> that didn't have much in it for the spinners last season. Fit-again <b>Akash Deep's</b> return to the squad will be a huge bonus and the pacer, who fronted the press on match eve, sounded confident about his match fitness.        <br>        <br>MI, having finally gotten on the board, would have travelled to Lucknow with a huge sigh of relief but sterner tests await them in Uttar Pradesh's capital. It would take some adjusting to the pitch, which will not have the intrinsic pace and bounce like Wankhede. Playing away from home anyway has been an issue for them lately, with 13 losses in 18 away games since the start of IPL 2023.        <br>        <br><b>When:</b> Match 16, on Friday, 4 April 2025, at 7:30 PM local        <br>        <br><b>Where:</b> Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow        <br>        <br><b>What to expect:</b> A black-soil pitch, with one of the sides even shorter than the last match. Five of the last six IPL matches here have been won by the chasing side, but no dew is expected on match day.        <br>        <br>The scores at this venue have shot up since the square was relaid ahead of the 2023 World Cup, but they are nowhere near what most other IPL venues promise since the Impact Rule rule kicked in. Part of that is to do with the large ground dimensions, which has meant that it's been harder to hit your way out of trouble after an early stutter. Negotiating the powerplay, which LSG didn't do very wellin their last match, will be crucial again.        <br>        <br><b>Head to head:</b> LSG 5 - 1 MI. The last time the teams met in Lucknow, LSG chased MI's 144 for 7 in the last over.        <br>        <br><b>Team news</b>        <br>        <br><b>Lucknow Super Giants</b>        <br>        <br><b>Injuries/Availability:</b> <b>Akash Deep</b> has joined the squad while <b>Mayank Yadav</b> continues to recover at <b>BCCI's newly-built Centre of Excellence (COE).</b> Akash sounded optimistic about Mayank joining the squad "soon".        <br>        <br><b>Tactics and match-ups:</b> <b>Avesh Khan</b> has been effective against <b>Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya,</b> but if he doesn't cut it with the new ball, <b>Ravi Bishnoi</b> comes in with great numbers against two key MI batters too. The leggie has dismissed both Rohit Sharma [in six innings] and Suryakumar [in seven innings] three times each.        <br><b>Probable XII:</b> Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram, Nicholas Pooran, Rishabh Pant (WK/C), Ayush Badoni, David Miller, Abdul Samad, Digvesh Singh Rathi, Shardul Thakur, Avesh Khan, Ravi Bishnoi, Prince Yadav/Akash Deep        <br>        <br><b>Mumbai Indians</b>        <br>        <br><b>Injuries/Availability:</b> No reported injuries in the camp.        <br>        <br><b>Tactics and match-ups:</b> Bowling spin to Rishabh Pant first up is a good option. The LSG captain has only 17 runs at a strike-rate of 65.38 in three outings this year so far. And his numbers against spin are even dire: 6 runs, 13 balls, 2 dismissals        <br>        <br><b>Probable XII:</b> Rohit Sharma, Ryan Rickelton(w), Will Jacks/Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya(c), Naman Dhir, Mitchell Santner, Deepak Chahar, Trent Boult, Ashwani Kumar, Vignesh Puthur/Satyanarayana Raju        <br>        <br><b>Did you know?</b>        <br>        <br>Of the six sub-150 totals defended in the IPL since 2022, three have been against LSG.        <br>        <br>Avesh doesn't have a very good record in Lucknow, with only three wickets in five matches at an average of 48.66, SR of 34 and ER of 8.58.        <br>        <br><b>What they said</b>        <br>        <br>"I feel the first match is very important for me. I have played one practice match but after a two to three-month gap, you don't get the confidence until you play the match" - <b>Akash Deep, LSG pacer</b>        <br>        <br>"It's about adaptability around whatever is presented on that particular day. As a former player and now part of coaching management, you want to be able to prepare for any eventuality and you try to control things that you can control. The nature of the surfaces is something that we can't control as a management and as a playing group, so whatever is presented, that's how you get to be called world-class and legends, that you are able to adapt to anything that is in front of you" - <b>Kieron Pollard, MI batting coach</b></p><!-- end ngIf: comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:news' && comm[ts].evt != 'Plugin:video' && comm[ts].evt !=
